trans-unit.source: How to create a custom driver installation script
trans-unit.target: How to create a custom driver installation script

trans-unit.source: If your deployment scenario requires more than installing the driver package on the test computers, you can choose to run your own custom command scripts upon installation.
trans-unit.target: If your deployment scenario requires more than installing the driver package on the test computers, you can choose to run your own custom command scripts upon installation.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Driver package that is test signed and ready to install.
trans-unit.target: Driver package that is test signed and ready to install.

trans-unit.source: You must first create and build your driver and then create a driver package for installation.
trans-unit.target: You must first create and build your driver and then create a driver package for installation.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Building a Driver](building_a_driver.md) and [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Building a Driver](building_a_driver.md) and [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md).

trans-unit.source: Test computers that are configured and provisioned for deployment.
trans-unit.target: Test computers that are configured and provisioned for deployment.

trans-unit.source: See [How to test a driver at runtime using Visual Studio](testing_a_driver_at_runtime.md).
trans-unit.target: See [How to test a driver at runtime using Visual Studio](testing_a_driver_at_runtime.md).

trans-unit.source: Instructions
trans-unit.target: Instructions

trans-unit.source: Step 1: To run your own custom command scripts upon installation
trans-unit.target: Step 1: To run your own custom command scripts upon installation

trans-unit.source: From the project property pages for your driver package, you can configure whether you want to automatically deploy a driver package on a test computer.
trans-unit.target: From the project property pages for your driver package, you can configure whether you want to automatically deploy a driver package on a test computer.

trans-unit.source: You can also run a custom installation script from these pages.
trans-unit.target: You can also run a custom installation script from these pages.

trans-unit.source: You can choose to deploy the driver automatically whenever you build the driver solution in each configuration.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to deploy the driver automatically whenever you build the driver solution in each configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information about deployment, see [Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer](deploying_a_driver_to_a_test_computer.md) and [Deployment Properties for Driver Projects](deployment_properties_for_driver_projects.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about deployment, see [Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer](deploying_a_driver_to_a_test_computer.md) and [Deployment Properties for Driver Projects](deployment_properties_for_driver_projects.md).

trans-unit.source: Open the property pages for your driver package project.
trans-unit.target: Open the property pages for your driver package project.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Settings**, and then click **Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Settings**, and then click **Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Enable deployment** and then select the test computer to use.
trans-unit.target: Click **Enable deployment** and then select the test computer to use.

trans-unit.source: Click **Custom Command Line**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Custom Command Line**.

trans-unit.source: In the box, type custom command scripts that you want to run upon installation.
trans-unit.target: In the box, type custom command scripts that you want to run upon installation.

trans-unit.source: In the **Additional Files** text box, add the command script and other installation files to be copied to the test computer.
trans-unit.target: In the **Additional Files** text box, add the command script and other installation files to be copied to the test computer.

trans-unit.source: When the driver is deployed, the additional files are copied to the *%Systemdrive%*\\drivertest\\drivers folder on the remote computer.
trans-unit.target: When the driver is deployed, the additional files are copied to the *%Systemdrive%*\\drivertest\\drivers folder on the remote computer.

trans-unit.source: Related topics
trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer
